channel.title: Homes on Michael Luu, MPH
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Michael Luu, MPH

item.description: Biography Michael Luu, MPH, is a research biostatistician at the Samuel Oschin Comprehensive Cancer Institute. Luu received his master’s in public health with an emphasis in biostatistics and epidemiology at the University of Southern California in 2015. He is a proficient R programmer who was also trained in SAS, STATA and SPSS. His experience involves survival analysis, predictive modeling and data visualizations, among other areas. Current and past projects involve analysis of large national inpatient databases such as the National Cancer Database, SEER-Medicare from the National Cancer Institute, Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project, California’s Office of Statewide Health Planning and Development and Pediatrics Health Information Systems.
